intro: Seriphidium sieberi, commonly known as the Sieber's tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range. Seriphidium sieberi is often found in grasslands and steppe habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
